attributes.attribute: [country code]_[center or hospital code]_[local biobank number] - Contry code basesd on ISO1366 alfa2 - Hospital code is RIZIV code - Biobank number assigned by CRC - Example of dummy value: ZZ_99999999999_999 - Example: BE_71014391000_001 (= Belgi?_UZ Brussel_DiabetesBiobankNr)" TODO - add taxonomy of options
Globally Unique Identifier GUID generated by Opal Identical donor_id for all the samples from the same donor per biobank
Coded number of the biological material
unique sample code e.g. sample barcode
IC - Informed consent - definition: Residual - Residual material - definition: XXX - Consent status unknown / missing - definition
Age of the donor at sampling date
Age of the donoer donor at sampling date expressed in months 9999 if unknown
Diagnosis of the patient at sampling date
ICD-10 code(s) ZZZ - Other, als niet aanwezig in ICD-10 XXX - Unknown, als niet aanwezig in ICD-10 HHH - Healthy, als niet aanwezig in ICD-10 at sampling date

Diagnosis of the tissue - Normal - Lesional material - Non-lesional material Unknown Other To Be Discussed: "Status of the material" is a very general label for a specific property of a tissue pathological / non-pathological instead of lesional / non-lesional ? add option "not applicable" for non tissue samples ?
Origin of the tissue material Solid: ICD-O3 topography codes Fluid: Not applicable
Date of removal of the biological material
yyyy-mm-dd Vb 2014-02-20 Year-month-day of removal of the biological material ISO8601 representation of dates no value if unknown
Is there a known biological or radiological risk ?
Nature of the human biological material: procedure

Solid: SPREC Type of collection (19 options, distinguish between autopsy/biopsy/excision/swab procedures) FLUIDDIA - Fluid - diagnostic FLUIDTHE - Fluid - therapeutic FLUIDAUT - Fluid - autopsy FLUIDSTU - Fluid - study XXX - Unknown ZZZ - Other
Biopsy in normal saline or phosphate buffered saline
Biopsy in tissue low temperature transport media
Surgical excision in normal saline or phosphate buffered saline
Surgical excision in tissue low temperature transport media
Nature of the human biological material: sample type
FLUID: type of sample (34 options) SOLID: type of sample (10 options) extended with DERIVATIVE DNA cDNA/mRNA microRNA XXX - Unknown ZZZ - Other
Fresh cells from nonblood specimen type
Cells from nonblood specimen type (e.g., ascites, amniotic), viable
Cells from non blood specimen type (e.g., ascites, amniotic), nonviable
Fresh cells from non blood specimen type (e.g., biopsy)
Cells from non blood specimen type (e.g., dissociated tissue), viable
Cells from laser capture microdissected tissue
Cells from non blood specimen type(e.g., dissociated tissue), nonviable
Information relating to the material manipulation (eg chemical fixation)

FLUID: SPREC type of primary container (27 options)

SOLID: SPREC fixation type (14 options)

Examples:

A (<2h between collection and processing)

ETH (alcohol-based fixation)

XXX - Unknown

ZZZ - Other
S8820 protease inhibitor tablets or equivalent
Serum separator tube with clot activator

FLUID + SOLID: long-term storage (25 options)

XXX - Unknown

ZZZ - Other

*RT, room temperature: 18C?28C

**PP, polypropylene

***LN, liquid nitrogen, referring to either vapor- or liquid-phase (this information being documented in the biobank?s SOPs) 

Volumes refer to container size.
Plastic cryo straw LN after temporary(-85)?C?(-60)?C
